---
title: "Lectures Overview"
---

These are all slides used for the “lecture” part of the course:

```{r, echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE, cache=FALSE}
# code inspired by https://github.com/ShKlinkenberg/statistics-lectures/blob/master/courses/SSR/2022-2023/SSR.qmd
# This code is evaluated within the lectures/ subfolder
# for testing: setwd("lectures")
files <- list.files(full.names = FALSE, pattern = "\\.qmd", recursive = TRUE)

# exclude the overview file
files <- files[!grepl("lecture_overview.qmd", files)]

lectures <- data.frame()
n <- length(files)

for (i in 1:n) {

  lectures[i ,'url'] <- data.frame(url = files[i])
  
  yaml <- rmarkdown::yaml_front_matter(files[i])
  
  lectures[i , 'title'] = yaml$title
  lectures[i , 'date'] = yaml$date
  order <- ifelse(is.null(yaml$order), 999, yaml$order)
  lectures[i , 'order'] = order  # the manual order in which to display the lectures
  lectures[i , 'file_name'] = files[i]
}

lectures <- lectures |> dplyr::arrange(order)

lecture.list <- data.frame(
           Lecture = lectures$title,
           Website = paste0('<a href="', gsub(".qmd", ".html", lectures$url, fixed=TRUE), '" target="_blank" class="external">link</a>'),
           Slides  = paste0('<a href="', gsub(".qmd", ".slide.html", lectures$url, fixed=TRUE), '" target="_blank" class="external">link</a>')
          )

library('kableExtra')
knitr::kable(
    lecture.list, 
    col.names = c("Topic", "Slides (as a single website)", "Slides (presentation mode)"),
    escape = FALSE
  )
  # For some reasons, kable_styling() escapes the < > html tags
  # %>%
  #kable_styling(full_width = TRUE)
```
